function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Implicit lag in time affecting intervention impact on deaths","Impact":"Weak manifestation of recent interventions in current deaths, leading to delayed understanding of intervention impact.","Mitigation":"Implement real-time monitoring of intervention impact and consider adjusting for the time lag in data analysis.","Technologies":"Real-time data analytics, predictive modeling, statistical time-series analysis.","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, data scientists, government policymakers.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, government health departments."},{"Description":"Bias in model due to inclusion of deaths from non-locally acquired infections","Impact":"Skewing the model's accuracy and reliability by including deaths from non-locally acquired infections, leading to inaccurate estimation of the impact of interventions.","Mitigation":"Create criteria to differentiate locally acquired and non-locally acquired infections, and exclude non-locally acquired deaths from the model.","Technologies":"Data filtering, geospatial analysis, epidemiological surveillance systems.","People":"Epidemiologists, statisticians, public health researchers.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, epidemiological surveillance organizations."},{"Description":"Deriving ifr from assumptions about homogeneous attack rates across age-groups","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of infection-fatality-ratio (ifr) due to assumption of homogeneous attack rates across age-groups, leading to biased model outputs.","Mitigation":"Account for age-specific mixing patterns and adjust ifr estimates accordingly to reflect the actual distribution of infection and mortality across age-groups.","Technologies":"Age-specific data analysis, demographic modeling, age-stratified mortality data collection.","People":"Epidemiologists, demographers, statisticians, public health researchers.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, demographic research organizations."}]}
